channel.title: System Can't Find the path specified! HELP PLEASE
channel.description:
Well i have the source and a client for me to start coding a 562. but when i compile or try to run it i get "System Can't Find the path specified" HERE ARE PICTURES
COMPILER CODE- [IMG]http://i186.photobucket.com/albums/x13/Hutch335/ComipilerCode.png[/img]
COMPILER MESSAGE- [IMG]http://i186.photobucket.com/albums/x13/Hutch335/Compilercantfind.png[/img]
RUN SERVER CODE- [IMG]http://i186.photobucket.com/albums/x13/Hutch335/RunServerCantFind.png[/img]
RUN SERVER MESSAGE- [IMG]http://i186.photobucket.com/albums/x13/Hutch335/RunServerCode.png[/img]
Here Are My CLASSPATH and my PATH [IMG]http://i186.photobucket.com/albums/x13/Hutch335/7-5-201010-29-05AM.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i186.photobucket.com/albums/x13/Hutch335/7-5-201010-28-44AM.png[/img] at the end of my CLASSPATH and PATH i added ;.; to make them work
Please help me out i am trying to get started and Thank you ahead of Time

item.title: System Can't Find the path specified! HELP PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @Heylo Heylo
item.description:
@Heylo wrote:

[quote=“w-e_s-l_e-y@hotmail.com, post:6, topic:347441”]I mean put [quote]C:[/quote] in front of you Path.

this are mines.
CLASPATH

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files(x86\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Path:

C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;

Are you sure your jdk1.6.0_20 are in program files (x86)? Because I have program files (x86) to, but my java is installed in normal program files…[/quote]

they are in both normal and 86

Read full topic

@echo off title Invision pking cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\Bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause

add in the change directory

item.title: System Can't Find the path specified! HELP PLEASE

item.description:
@w-e_s-l_e-y wrote:

I mean put

C:</blockquote> in front of you Path.

this are mines.
CLASPATH

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files(x86\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Path:

C:\Program Files(x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;

Are you sure your jdk1.6.0_20 are in program files (x86)? Because I have program files (x86) to, but my java is installed in normal program files…
